text: Iron, Migdal El, Horem, Beth Anath and Beth Shemesh. There were nineteen towns and their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: These towns and their villages were the inheritance of the tribe of Naphtali, according to its clans.
speaker: Narrator

text: The seventh lot came out for the tribe of Dan according to its clans.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The territory of their inheritance included:
Zorah, Eshtaol, Ir Shemesh,
speaker: Narrator

text: Shaalabbin, Aijalon, Ithlah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Elon, Timnah, Ekron,
speaker: Narrator

text: Eltekeh, Gibbethon, Baalath,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jehud, Bene Berak, Gath Rimmon,
speaker: Narrator

text: Me Jarkon and Rakkon, with the area facing Joppa.
speaker: Narrator

text: (When the territory of the Danites was lost to them, they went up and attacked Leshem, took it, put it to the sword and occupied it. They settled in Leshem and named it Dan after their ancestor.)
speaker: Narrator

text: These towns and their villages were the inheritance of the tribe of Dan, according to its clans.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had finished dividing the land into its allotted portions, the Israelites gave Joshua son of Nun an inheritance among them,
speaker: Narrator

text: as the Lord had commanded. They gave him the town he asked for – Timnath Serah in the hill country of Ephraim. And he built up the town and settled there.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the territories that Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun and the heads of the tribal clans of Israel assigned by lot at Shiloh in the presence of the Lord at the entrance to the tent of meeting. And so they finished dividing the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said to Joshua:
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Tell the Israelites to designate the cities of refuge, as I instructed you through Moses,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that anyone who kills a person accidentally and unintentionally may flee there and find protection from the avenger of blood.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they flee to one of these cities, they are to stand in the entrance of the city gate and state their case before the elders of that city. Then the elders are to admit the fugitive into their city and provide a place to live among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: If the avenger of blood comes in pursuit, the elders must not surrender the fugitive, because the fugitive killed their neighbour unintentionally and without malice aforethought.
speaker: Narrator

text: They are to stay in that city until they have stood trial before the assembly and until the death of the high priest who is serving at that time. Then they may go back to their own home in the town from which they fled.’
speaker: Narrator

text: So they set apart Kedesh in Galilee in the hill country of Naphtali, Shechem in the hill country of Ephraim, and Kiriath Arba (that is, Hebron) in the hill country of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: East of the Jordan (on the other side from Jericho) they designated Bezer in the wilderness on the plateau in the tribe of Reuben, Ramoth in Gilead in the tribe of Gad, and Golan in Bashan in the tribe of Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Any of the Israelites or any foreigner residing among them who killed someone accidentally could flee to these designated cities and not be killed by the avenger of blood prior to standing trial before the assembly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the family heads of the Levites approached Eleazar the priest, Joshua son of Nun, and the heads of the other tribal families of Israel
speaker: Narrator

text: at Shiloh in Canaan and said to them, ‘The Lord commanded through Moses that you give us towns to live in, with pasture-lands for our livestock.’
speaker: Narrator

text: So, as the Lord had commanded, the Israelites gave the Levites the following towns and pasture-lands out of their own inheritance:
speaker: Narrator

text: The first lot came out for the Kohathites, according to their clans. The Levites who were descendants of Aaron the priest were allotted thirteen towns from the tribes of Judah, Simeon and Benjamin.
speaker: Narrator

text: The rest of Kohath’s descendants were allotted ten towns from the clans of the tribes of Ephraim, Dan and half of Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Gershon were allotted thirteen towns from the clans of the tribes of Issachar, Asher, Naphtali and the half-tribe of Manasseh in Bashan.
speaker: Narrator

text: The descendants of Merari, according to their clans, received twelve towns from the tribes of Reuben, Gad and Zebulun.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Israelites allotted to the Levites these towns and their pasture-lands, as the Lord had commanded through Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the tribes of Judah and Simeon they allotted the following towns by name
speaker: Narrator

text: (these towns were assigned to the descendants of Aaron who were from the Kohathite clans of the Levites, because the first lot fell to them):
speaker: Narrator

text: They gave them Kiriath Arba (that is, Hebron), with its surrounding pasture-land, in the hill country of Judah. (Arba was the forefather of Anak.)
speaker: Narrator

text: But the fields and villages around the city they had given to Caleb son of Jephunneh as his possession.
speaker: Narrator

text: So to the descendants of Aaron the priest they gave Hebron (a city of refuge for one accused of murder), Libnah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jattir, Eshtemoa,
speaker: Narrator

text: Holon, Debir,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ain, Juttah and Beth Shemesh, together with their pasture-lands – nine towns from these two tribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And from the tribe of Benjamin they gave them Gibeon, Geba,
speaker: Narrator

text: Anathoth and Almon, together with their pasture-lands – four towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: The total number of towns for the priests, the descendants of Aaron, came to thirteen, together with their pasture-lands.
speaker: Narrator

text: The rest of the Kohathite clans of the Levites were allotted towns from the tribe of Ephraim:
speaker: Narrator

text: In the hill country of Ephraim they were given Shechem (a city of refuge for one accused of murder) and Gezer,
speaker: Narrator

text: Kibzaim and Beth Horon, together with their pasture-lands – four towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also from the tribe of Dan they received Eltekeh, Gibbethon,
speaker: Narrator

text: Aijalon and Gath Rimmon, together with their pasture-lands – four towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: From half the tribe of Manasseh they received Taanach and Gath Rimmon, together with their pasture-lands – two towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: All these ten towns and their pasture-lands were given to the rest of the Kohathite clans.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
from the tribe of Issachar,
Kishion, Daberath,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jarmuth and En Gannim, together with their pasture-lands – four towns;
speaker: Narrator

text:
from the tribe of Asher,
Mishal, Abdon,
speaker: Narrator

text: Helkath and Rehob, together with their pasture-lands – four towns;
speaker: Narrator

text:
from the tribe of Naphtali,
Kedesh in Galilee (a city of refuge for one accused of murder), Hammoth Dor and Kartan, together with their pasture-lands – three towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: The total number of towns of the Gershonite clans came to thirteen, together with their pasture-lands.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text: Dimnah and Nahalal, together with their pasture-lands – four towns;
speaker: Narrator

text:
from the tribe of Reuben,
Bezer, Jahaz,
speaker: Narrator

text: Kedemoth and Mephaath, together with their pasture-lands – four towns;
speaker: Narrator

text:
from the tribe of Gad,
Ramoth in Gilead (a city of refuge for one accused of murder), Mahanaim,
speaker: Narrator

text: Heshbon and Jazer, together with their pasture-lands – four towns in all.
speaker: Narrator

text: The total number of towns allotted to the Merarite clans, who were the rest of the Levites, came to twelve.
speaker: Narrator

text: The towns of the Levites in the territory held by the Israelites were forty-eight in all, together with their pasture-lands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Each of these towns had pasture-lands surrounding it; this was true for all these towns.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Lord gave Israel all the land he had sworn to give their ancestors, and they took possession of it and settled there.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord gave them rest on every side, just as he had sworn to their ancestors. Not one of their enemies withstood them; the Lord gave all their enemies into their hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not one of all the Lord’s good promises to Israel failed; every one was fulfilled.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua summoned the Reubenites, the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh
speaker: Narrator

text: and said to them, ‘You have done all that Moses the servant of the Lord commanded, and you have obeyed me in everything I commanded.
speaker: Narrator

text: For a long time now – to this very day – you have not deserted your fellow Israelites but have carried out the mission the Lord your God gave you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now that the Lord your God has given them rest as he promised, return to your homes in the land that Moses the servant of the Lord gave you on the other side of the Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: But be very careful to keep the commandment and the law that Moses the servant of the Lord gave you: to love the Lord your God, to walk in obedience to him, to keep his commands, to hold fast to him and to serve him with all your heart and with all your soul.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua blessed them and sent them away, and they went to their homes.
speaker: Narrator

text: (To the half-tribe of Manasseh Moses had given land in Bashan, and to the other half of the tribe Joshua gave land on the west side of the Jordan along with their fellow Israelites.) When Joshua sent them home, he blessed them,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, ‘Return to your homes with your great wealth – with large herds of livestock, with silver, gold, bronze and iron, and a great quantity of clothing – and divide the plunder from your enemies with your fellow Israelites.’
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Reubenites, the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh left the Israelites at Shiloh in Canaan to return to Gilead, their own land, which they had acquired in accordance with the command of the Lord through Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they came to Geliloth near the Jordan in the land of Canaan, the Reubenites, the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh built an imposing altar there by the Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the Israelites heard that they had built the altar on the border of Canaan at Geliloth near the Jordan on the Israelite side,
speaker: Narrator

text: the whole assembly of Israel gathered at Shiloh to go to war against them.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Israelites sent Phinehas son of Eleazar, the priest, to the land of Gilead – to Reuben, Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: With him they sent ten of the chief men, one from each of the tribes of Israel, each the head of a family division among the Israelite clans.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they went to Gilead – to Reuben, Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh – they said to them:
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘The whole assembly of the Lord says: “How could you break faith with the God of Israel like this? How could you turn away from the Lord and build yourselves an altar in rebellion against him now?
speaker: Narrator

text: Was not the sin of Peor enough for us? Up to this very day we have not cleansed ourselves from that sin, even though a plague fell on the community of the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
And are you now turning away from the Lord?
‘“If you rebel against the Lord today, tomorrow he will be angry with the whole community of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: If the land you possess is defiled, come over to the Lord’s land, where the Lord’s tabernacle stands, and share the land with us. But do not rebel against the Lord or against us by building an altar for yourselves, other than the altar of the Lord our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Achan son of Zerah was unfaithful in regard to the devoted things, did not wrath come on the whole community of Israel? He was not the only one who died for his sin.”’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Reuben, Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh replied to the heads of the clans of Israel:
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘The Mighty One, God, the Lord! The Mighty One, God, the Lord! He knows! And let Israel know! If this has been in rebellion or disobedience to the Lord, do not spare us this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: If we have built our own altar to turn away from the Lord and to offer burnt offerings and grain offerings, or to sacrifice fellowship offerings on it, may the Lord himself call us to account.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘No! We did it for fear that some day your descendants might say to ours, “What do you have to do with the Lord, the God of Israel?
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord has made the Jordan a boundary between us and you – you Reubenites and Gadites! You have no share in the Lord.” So your descendants might cause ours to stop fearing the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘That is why we said, “Let us get ready and build an altar – but not for burnt offerings or sacrifices.”
speaker: Narrator

text: On the contrary, it is to be a witness between us and you and the generations that follow, that we will worship the Lord at his sanctuary with our burnt offerings, sacrifices and fellowship offerings. Then in the future your descendants will not be able to say to ours, “You have no share in the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘And we said, “If they ever say this to us, or to our descendants, we will answer: look at the replica of the Lord’s altar, which our ancestors built, not for burnt offerings and sacrifices, but as a witness between us and you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Far be it from us to rebel against the Lord and turn away from him today by building an altar for burnt offerings, grain offerings and sacrifices, other than the altar of the Lord our God that stands before his tabernacle.’
speaker: Narrator

text: When Phinehas the priest and the leaders of the community – the heads of the clans of the Israelites – heard what Reuben, Gad and Manasseh had to say, they were pleased.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Phinehas son of Eleazar, the priest, said to Reuben, Gad and Manasseh, ‘Today we know that the Lord is with us, because you have not been unfaithful to the Lord in this matter. Now you have rescued the Israelites from the Lord’s hand.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Phinehas son of Eleazar, the priest, and the leaders returned to Canaan from their meeting with the Reubenites and Gadites in Gilead and reported to the Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were glad to hear the report and praised God. And they talked no more about going to war against them to devastate the country where the Reubenites and the Gadites lived.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Reubenites and the Gadites gave the altar this name: A Witness Between Us – that the Lord is God.
speaker: Narrator

text: After a long time had passed and the Lord had given Israel rest from all their enemies around them, Joshua, by then a very old man,
speaker: Narrator

text: summoned all Israel – their elders, leaders, judges and officials – and said to them: ‘I am very old.
speaker: Narrator

text: You yourselves have seen everything the Lord your God has done to all these nations for your sake; it was the Lord your God who fought for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember how I have allotted as an inheritance for your tribes all the land of the nations that remain – the nations I conquered – between the Jordan and the Mediterranean Sea in the west.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord your God himself will push them out for your sake. He will drive them out before you, and you will take possession of their land, as the Lord your God promised you.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Be very strong; be careful to obey all that is written in the Book of the Law of Moses, without turning aside to the right or to the left.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not associate with these nations that remain among you; do not invoke the names of their gods or swear by them. You must not serve them or bow down to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you are to hold fast to the Lord your God, as you have until now.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘The Lord has driven out before you great and powerful nations; to this day no one has been able to withstand you.
speaker: Narrator

text: One of you routs a thousand, because the Lord your God fights for you, just as he promised.
speaker: Narrator

text: So be very careful to love the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘But if you turn away and ally yourselves with the survivors of these nations that remain among you and if you intermarry with them and associate with them,
speaker: Narrator

text: then you may be sure that the Lord your God will no longer drive out these nations before you. Instead, they will become snares and traps for you, whips on your backs and thorns in your eyes, until you perish from this good land, which the Lord your God has given you.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Now I am about to go the way of all the earth. You know with all your heart and soul that not one of all the good promises the Lord your God gave you has failed. Every promise has been fulfilled; not one has failed.
speaker: Narrator

text: But just as all the good things the Lord your God has promised you have come to you, so he will bring on you all the evil things he has threatened, until the Lord your God has destroyed you from this good land he has given you.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you violate the covenant of the Lord your God, which he commanded you, and go and serve other gods and bow down to them, the Lord’s anger will burn against you, and you will quickly perish from the good land he has given you.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua assembled all the tribes of Israel at Shechem. He summoned the elders, leaders, judges and officials of Israel, and they presented themselves before God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua said to all the people, ‘This is what the Lord, the God of Israel, says: “Long ago your ancestors, including Terah the father of Abraham and Nahor, lived beyond the River Euphrates and worshipped other gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I took your father Abraham from the land beyond the Euphrates and led him throughout Canaan and gave him many descendants. I gave him Isaac,
speaker: Narrator

text: and to Isaac I gave Jacob and Esau. I assigned the hill country of Seir to Esau, but Jacob and his family went down to Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘“Then I sent Moses and Aaron, and I afflicted the Egyptians by what I did there, and I brought you out.
speaker: Narrator

text: When I brought your people out of Egypt, you came to the sea, and the Egyptians pursued them with chariots and horsemen as far as the Red Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they cried to the Lord for help, and he put darkness between you and the Egyptians; he brought the sea over them and covered them. You saw with your own eyes what I did to the Egyptians. Then you lived in the wilderness for a long time.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘“I brought you to the land of the Amorites who lived east of the Jordan. They fought against you, but I gave them into your hands. I destroyed them from before you, and you took possession of their land.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Balak son of Zippor, the king of Moab, prepared to fight against Israel, he sent for Balaam son of Beor to put a curse on you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I would not listen to Balaam, so he blessed you again and again, and I delivered you out of his hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘“Then you crossed the Jordan and came to Jericho. The citizens of Jericho fought against you, as did also the Amorites, Perizzites, Canaanites, Hittites, Girgashites, Hivites and Jebusites, but I gave them into your hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: I sent the hornet ahead of you, which drove them out before you – also the two Amorite kings. You did not do it with your own sword and bow.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I gave you a land on which you did not toil and cities you did not build; and you live in them and eat from vineyards and olive groves that you did not plant.”
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Now fear the Lord and serve him with all faithfulness. Throw away the gods your ancestors worshipped beyond the River Euphrates and in Egypt, and serve the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if serving the Lord seems undesirable to you, then choose for yourselves this day whom you will serve, whether the gods your ancestors served beyond the Euphrates, or the gods of the Amorites, in whose land you are living. But as for me and my household, we will serve the Lord.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the people answered, ‘Far be it from us to forsake the Lord to serve other gods!
speaker: Narrator

text: It was the Lord our God himself who brought us and our parents up out of Egypt, from that land of slavery, and performed those great signs before our eyes. He protected us on our entire journey and among all the nations through which we travelled.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord drove out before us all the nations, including the Amorites, who lived in the land. We too will serve the Lord, because he is our God.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua said to the people, ‘You are not able to serve the Lord. He is a holy God; he is a jealous God. He will not forgive your rebellion and your sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you forsake the Lord and serve foreign gods, he will turn and bring disaster on you and make an end of you, after he has been good to you.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But the people said to Joshua, ‘No! We will serve the Lord.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then Joshua said, ‘You are witnesses against yourselves that you have chosen to serve the Lord.’
‘Yes, we are witnesses,’ they replied.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Now then,’ said Joshua, ‘throw away the foreign gods that are among you and yield your hearts to the Lord, the God of Israel.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And the people said to Joshua, ‘We will serve the Lord our God and obey him.’
speaker: Narrator

text: On that day Joshua made a covenant for the people, and there at Shechem he reaffirmed for them decrees and laws.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua recorded these things in the Book of the Law of God. Then he took a large stone and set it up there under the oak near the holy place of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘See!’ he said to all the people. ‘This stone will be a witness against us. It has heard all the words the Lord has said to us. It will be a witness against you if you are untrue to your God.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua dismissed the people, each to their own inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: After these things, Joshua son of Nun, the servant of the Lord, died at the age of a hundred and ten.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they buried him in the land of his inheritance, at Timnath Serah in the hill country of Ephraim, north of Mount Gaash.
speaker: Narrator

text: Israel served the Lord throughout the lifetime of Joshua and of the elders who outlived him and who had experienced everything the Lord had done for Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joseph’s bones, which the Israelites had brought up from Egypt, were buried at Shechem in the tract of land that Jacob bought for a hundred pieces of silver from the sons of Hamor, the father of Shechem. This became the inheritance of Joseph’s descendants.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Eleazar son of Aaron died and was buried at Gibeah, which had been allotted to his son Phinehas in the hill country of Ephraim.
speaker: Narrator
